relation: siue has one of the safest campuses in illinois. there are plenty of on duty officers around campus at all times and the dorm rules also ensure safety.

for fun, the fitness center has a lot of activities you can participate in and meet new people. you can hang out with friends, play sports with friends, work out, go swimming, rock climbing, bowling; just to name a few.

there are different varieties of food available but it could be better. after a while, you just want something different because you eventually get tired of the campus food. luckily, there are other restaurants to order from but are not walking distance, so the buses and/or delivery comes in handy if you don't have a car.

the dorms are really comfortable and safe. they're spacious and nothing like the usual college dorms that could be compared to a prison cell. there is around the clock staff to ensure safety at all times and friendly residence assistants.

it's best to aim for a gpa of a 4.0 and don't fall under a 2.0. late work is unacceptable unless you have a good reason for it. unexcused absences also effects your grades so attend your classes everyday.

tips for prospective students is to stay focus. college is not a place to slack off and fall behind. this is for your future, so don't waste your time and money if you're not serious about furthering your education.

siue is a great school for students of all majors and brings you diversity in a safe environment. help is always provided if needed whether you would prefer help from a professor, another student, or a study group for any course. this is a challenging school but it is doable for anyone willing to accomplish their educational goals.
pageTitle: SIU Edwardsville (SIUE) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {27252=The food and dining at SIUe are amazing! There are places to eat in many different buildings so it's easy to grab a snack between any classes. SIUe's food and dining include: an Entree's, a pasta bar, nacho bar, potato bar, Deli/Panini/ a Grill, Wok (Chinese), Chick-Fil-A, University Restaurant, Kaldi's, Starbucks, Pizza Hut/Wing Street, Taco Bell, Union Station, Skywalk Food Court, Commons Grill, Woodland Cart, Bluff Cafe, Auntie Ann's, Sweet E's (ice cream), and my personal favorite Freshens. There's also a rumor on campus about a Panara Bread for the 2012-2013 year., 252751=Tuition is only 2900 per semester, with fees it comes around to about 4000 a semester which isn't bad at all for a University. You get a great education for a low tuition cost., 439266=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 334446=Parties and chilling with friends in the dorms. Without a car, you won't be able to enjoy having fun off campus after a certain time of the day because the buses leaving and coming back to campus stop after about 5:00 pm}

You could win a free scholarship. textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Katie from Chicago, IL 10/08/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 17 out of 18 people found this review useful. 3 of 102 Categories Comments Great for these types of students If you like: ~ To meet people from all over the USA and world ~ Nature and animals ~ To learn about yourself and others ~ Cheer for division 1 soccer and volleyball Tips for prospective students Get involved just like high school, when you join activities you meet so many new people! Take advantage of the Student Fitness Center! It is apart of your tuition! Bang for the buck I think I am getting a great education here. Housing is wonderful and the prices are reasonable. Am enjoying being here I love SIUe a lot. I have lived in housing for both my years here and I love it. The Resident Assistants are wonderful
